topic.title: What's new in Release 14.2
topic.p: For Mingle onsite customers, please review the upgrade instructions before moving to Mingle 14.2

note.item: All of the features below are already available for our Mingle in the cloud customers.

section.title: Sticky Column Headers
section.p: Is your screen too small to show all existing cards on your wall? Can’t remember which swim lane they’re in when you’ve scrolled to the bottom of the wall? Now, your column headers stick so you always know where you—and your cards—are. Read more here.

section.title: Quick Add + Card to any Column
section.p: Want to add a card to your wall on the fly? Now, you can add a card to any column by clicking on the blue “+” that appears when you hover over any column. Read more here.

section.title: Drag and Drop Avatars
section.p: In Mingle 14.1, we added avatars so you can see your smiling faces on your card wall. Now in 14.2 you can easily change who's working on what with an easy drag and drop interaction. Learn more about avatars.

section.title: Invite team by email
section.p: Now you can invite your team with a simple email! Just click on the pink user + icon in the bottom tray and invite away! Read more here.

section.title: Reorder and Rename Columns and Tabs
section.p: To help you more easily configure Mingle to support how your team works as you evolve and improve over time, we've made it much easier to rename and reorder both columns and tabs. Now, you can simply drag project columns and tabs to reorder them. And, to rename them, just click on the pencil, which appears when you hover over any column or tab.

section.title: New Scrum Template
section.p: New Scrum template features include: more out-of-the-box reports, a Story Map, Release Planning, an Estimation board, a Sprint board, and even a Retrospective board! Read more here and learn more about Mingle templates.

section.title: Expand and Collapse Properties on Card Preview
section.p: Want to see all of the properties on your card preview to get more detail? Just expand the property drop-down arrow to see all of your card’s property values. And collapse it to return to the single line of properties so you can refocus on your discussion on your card’s content. (Please note only properties whose values are set will appear on the card preview.) Read more here.

section.title: Recover Unsaved Changes
section.p: Mingle now knows when you have unsaved changes and asks if you want to recover them. Read more here.

section.title: Git and GitHub integration
section.p: Mingle in the cloud now supports both Git and GitHub integration. When you integrate either with Mingle, your commits will appear as Murmurs. And if you reference a specific card number in your commit message, it will appear as a murmur on the individual card as well. Read more here.

section.title: New and Improved Murmurs
section.p: We've done a lot of work with Murmurs to make them a central communication channel for you and your team. Here are the highlights:

bullets.item: Email notifications when you murmur @someone: Now you get an email when you’re murmured at so you don’t miss a beat. Just @ the team member you’re murmuring with and they’ll get an email. Whether outside the office or simply not in Mingle at the moment, these notifications help make sure you know what’s going on with your team.

Autocomplete @teammate: To help you murmur with your team, Mingle will autocomplete the name of the team member you’re murmuring at, saving you time and making sure there are no typos :) Just select the name you’re looking for as soon as it appears and you’re set. They’ll receive an email as soon as you’ve murmured your message.

@team and @group: Sometimes you need to talk with your entire team or specific groups in your project (devs or QAs, for example). When you murmur @team, everyone on your team receives an email. And if you’ve defined groups in your project, Mingle will automatically know so you can murmur a specific message to a single group and everyone in that group will know!
New location: We moved Murmurs to give it a more prominent location in your project. You'll now see it next to the search bar instead of among your tabs.

Murmurs only; no more comments: Previously, Comments and Murmurs were distinct concepts in Mingle. We’ve combined them now as just Murmurs. You can still add a message directly to a card, but instead of that message living deep within the card – and therefore hard to quickly see for the rest of your team – it will now show up in your team’s Murmur stream. This way everyone sees it and has shared context about what is going on.

section.title: Navigation and UI Improvements
section.p: We published an entire post about it, but here's a quick rundown of the navigation and UI improvements available in Mingle 14.2:

bullets.item: Quick project navigation: switch between projects by selecting the project drop down menu next to your project name in the Mingle header.
Better default avatars: if you haven't set your avatar, Mingle will default it to the first initial of your name, making it easier to know who's who on your team.

Pick a color with 1-click: we've made it easier to choose colors for everything (from property values to card types) in your Mingle project. With a more limited and aesthetic palette, you can select a color with just one click.
A card wall that looks more like a card wall: we've added more contrast and streamlined our card wall to remove linear distractions and make it appear more like the card wall it is.

Quick navigation to everything cards: now you can quickly navigate to to your project’s card types, properties, transitions, trees, and keywords to make larger underlying changes to card settings. Just click on the gear on the card preview. (Unlike the above, this functionality is highlighted in this post.)

section.title: End of Life for Jabber Integration and Support for Older Browsers
section.p: 14.2 marks the end of life for Jabber integration and support for older browsers. Read more here.
